scenario_text.value:
Hm? Haru, oh, and Miyuki too. What are you
two doing?

(He’s...wrapping string around his fingers?
It almost seems familiar, but why?)
Cat’s cradle.

Oh, right! That old game you play with
string. I’m surprised you know how to do it.
My sister loves this game.
Oh, okay...

(He says that, but it looks to me like he’s
playing and Miyuki is just watching.)
How does it work? I want to play too!

You tie a string into a loop, then use your
fingers to make shapes.
But it might be hard with fingers like yours.
Oh, man...

(Haru sure seems relaxed. Has he given any
thought to what might happen next?)

(Then again, he’s still pretty young. Maybe
it’s best that he plays quietly by himself.)
(What should I say to those two?)
Stop playing games!
Let me play, too.
Any thoughts, Miyuki?
Scold them.

Do you even realize the situation we’re in?!
We’re all trying to think of how to survive!

I don’t care if you are little kids, you
can’t just spend all your time playing games!
It doesn’t matter what we do.
Huh?

Whether we stay in here or go outside. If we
get found out, we’re done for.

The best thing to do is hide, then run if
we’re found out. That’s all there is to it.
Found out...by who? Who are you running from?
Hm? Miyuki?
Ask to play.

I’d like to try playing, too. Would you teach
me how?
Yeah, sure.

You start out like this, then catch the
string with this finger, and let go here.
Whoa! You’re really good at that, Takuma!

(Huh, now it looks like a star. This is
surprisingly fun.)

(I was hoping to learn more about these two,
but right now they seem like ordinary kids.)

Can you do this too, Miyuki? Why don’t you
show me...huh?
Ask Miyuki’s opinion.
So, Miyuki...any thoughts?

Uh, you know, about whether we should stay in
here or look around outside?
Does it really matter?
Um, Haru, I was asking Miyuki just now.

In here, out there... They’ll attack. We’ll
find nothing. Either way, it’s the same.
Wha...?! You answered properly?
Miyuki...?
Zzz... Zzz...
(She’s...asleep? That was fast.)
My sister is tired. You should let her sleep.
Uh, yeah. I guess...

All right, Agumon, we’d better head somewhere
else. You know, quietly.
You got it!

You should let my sister sleep. Why don’t you
go talk to the others?
